main event: The chief officer of the Greek steamer Frixos observed what were probably two satellites in the sky while the ship was en route towards New Zealand on July 26th, 1964.
interesting points: The objects were described as being the size and brightness of the planet Jupiter, with one appearing red and green, and the other red and white.
The objects were observed orbiting from east to west, and were steady in their distance from each other.

After two minutes, another object of the same brightness but white in color was observed moving from southwest to northeast at a high altitude, passing directly over the ship before disappearing close to the star Vega.
The sighting occurred between 0225Z and 0258Z GMT.
No evaluation or conclusion was provided in the report.
sighted object: two satellite-like objects and a third high-speed white object
location: 15-31 S 132-31 W, en route to New Zealand
witnesses: chief officer of the Greek steamer Frixos
